docs.title: Code of conduct
docs.description: As contributors and maintainers of the React Document Editor package, we are dedicated to demonstrating respect to all individuals who contribute to this project. This respect encompasses actions such as posting issues, updating documentation, submitting pull requests, providing constructive feedback in comments, and engaging in any other project-related activities.

docs.title: Contributors
docs.description: - Ashutosh Jena

docs.title: How to Contribute
docs.description: We genuinely appreciate your interest in contributing to the React Document Editor project. Your invaluable contributions play a pivotal role in enhancing this project. Before you embark on your journey, please take a moment to familiarize yourself with the following guidelines:

docs.title: Installation
docs.description: The Angular Document Editor is a collection of npm packages, which can be found on GitHub.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.description: Let's explore the Document Editor in less than 5 minutes.

docs.description: | Event         |                                                                                |

docs.description: | Option              | Purpose                                                                                                                                                       |

docs.title: Change logs
docs.description: Version 1

docs.title: How to customize style
docs.description: Tailor the editor's user interface to align with the specific requirements of your application.

docs.title: How to customize toolbar
docs.description: Customizing the user interface and actions of the editor to align with your application's requirements is essential.

docs.title: How to use DOM events
docs.description: Mastering the handling of DOM events is crucial for effective React development. Below are key events and how to use them:

docs.title: What is Angular Document Editor?
docs.description: angular-canvas-editor is a tool that allows developers to integrate multipage document editor inside react application.

docs.title: Why Canvas Editor
docs.description: Canvas vs HTML Editor
